summary: Core QR generation UI (content entry, customization, preview, PNG download) and Internet Identity-based gating for history are present, but key requirements around PWA installability, brand assets, and full saved-history CRUD/persistence are missing or incomplete. The diff also adds unrequested profile/access-control features and expands QR content types beyond the minimum scope.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend exposes methods to create/list/delete saved QR items scoped to the caller identity; items persist across reloads/sessions; listing returns items in a consistent order (e.g., newest first).
missing_requirements.reason: The backend only implements save and list; no delete method is shown. Data structures are non-stable in the shown code, so persistence across canister upgrades is not evidenced. Listing order is whatever List.add/toArray yields; no explicit sorting/newest-first is implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: History UI supports deleting items (with confirmation) and removal from the list.
missing_requirements.reason: UI shows a confirmation dialog with a Delete action, but there is no onClick handler wired to a delete mutation, and there is no backend delete API in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Installable PWA behavior (web app manifest + service worker) with basic offline support for the shell UI.
missing_requirements.reason: No manifest or service worker files/registration are shown in the diff summary (only src files were added; no public/manifest/service worker additions are evidenced).

missing_requirements.requirement: Add generated static brand assets (logo + app icons) into the frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the header and PWA manifest; no image assets served via backend APIs.
missing_requirements.reason: Header references a logo path, but the actual generated assets files and any PWA manifest icon references are not shown as added in the diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile setup (name capture) and profile CRUD endpoints.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not ask for user profiles; it only requires II sign-in to save/view QR history.

hallucinated_features.description: Custom access control initialization via secret parameter and admin token handling.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request an admin/secret-token-based access control system; only Internet Identity authentication is required.

hallucinated_features.description: Support for many QR content types beyond the minimum (text + URL), such as WiFi, vCard contact, geo location, calendar event, SMS, etc.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest minimum scope is plain text and URL (additional types were not requested).

hallucinated_features.description: Footer marketing links (caffeine.ai attribution, GitHub link) and decorative elements.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest requirements/AC.
